member.summary: A collection of static methods for analyzing and comparing 2D curves.

member.summary: Represents a curve as a list of points.

member.summary: Options for shape similarity calculation.

member.summary: Options for Procrustes curve normalization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.SubdivideCurveOpts
member.summary: Options for curve subdivision.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.RebalanceCurveOpts
member.summary: Options for curve rebalancing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ArrSum(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Double})
member.summary: Sums all elements in a list of numbers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ArrAverage(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Double})
member.summary: Calculates the average of a list of numbers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Subtract(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Subtracts point v2 from v1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Magnitude(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Calculates the magnitude (length) of a vector from the origin.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.FrechetDist(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve)
member.summary: Discrete Frechet distance between 2 curves. Based on http://www.kr.tuwien.ac.at/staff/eiter/et-archive/cdtr9464.pdf Modified to be iterative and have better memory usage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ShapeSimilarity(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ShapeSimilarityOpts)
member.summary: Estimate how similar the shapes of 2 curves are to each other, accounting for translation, scale, and rotation.
member.returns: A value between 1 and 0 depending on how similar the shapes are, where 1 means identical.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ProcrustesNormalizeCurve(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ProcrustesNormalizeCurveOpts)
member.summary: Translate and scale curve by Procrustes Analysis. Optionally runs RebalanceCurve first (default true). From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procrustes_analysis

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.FindProcrustesRotationAngle(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve)
member.summary: Find the angle to rotate `curve` to match the rotation of `relativeCurve` using procrustes analysis. From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procrustes_analysis `curve` and `relativeCurve` must have the same number of points. `curve` and `relativeCurve` should both be run through ProcrustesNormalizeCurve first.
member.param: The curve to match rotation with.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ProcrustesNormalizeRotation(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve)
member.summary: Rotate `curve` to match the rotation of `relativeCurve` using procrustes analysis. From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procrustes_analysis `curve` and `relativeCurve` must have the same number of points. `curve` and `relativeCurve` should both be run through ProcrustesNormalizeCurve first.
member.param: The curve to match rotation with.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.PointDistance(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Calculate the distance between 2 points.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.CurveLength(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve)
member.summary: Calculate the length of the curve.
member.param: The curve as a list of points.
member.returns: The total length of the curve.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.ExtendPointOnLine(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point,System.Double)
member.summary: Return a new point, p3, which is on the same line as p1 and p2, but dist away from p2. p1, p2, p3 will always lie on the line in that order (as long as dist is positive).
member.param: The first point defining the line.
The second point defining the line.
The distance from p2 to the new point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.SubdivideCurve(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.SubdivideCurveOpts)
member.summary: Break up long segments in the curve into smaller segments of len maxLen or smaller.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.RebalanceCurve(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.Curve,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.CurveAnalysis.RebalanceCurveOpts)
member.summary: Redraw the curve using `numPoints` points equally spaced along the length of the curve. This may result in a slightly different shape than the original if `numPoints` is low.

member.summary: Rotate the curve around the origin.
member.param: The angle to rotate by, in radians.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.OcrTextMatches
member.summary: Make text matches of the ocr text data

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.OcrTextMatches.MatchGroup(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.Trajectory,System.String,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Math.MachineVision.ConfusionChars)
member.summary: Get text matches score of the ocr text data
member.returns: the text similarity matches score, higher is better. The score is calculated by Levenshtein distance, which is a measure of the similarity between two strings.
member.remarks: The score is calculated by Levenshtein distance, which is a measure of the similarity between two strings. The distance is the number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions, or substitutions) required to change one string into the other.
